pair.Prompt: In United States v. Freight Association (1896), what was the ruling of the court regarding the interpretation of the words "every restraint of trade" used in the act?
pair.Response: Response: The court ruled that the words "every restraint of trade" used in the act should be interpreted as excluding reasonable contracts, as the fact that such contracts were not considered to be within the rule of contracts in restraint of trade was thoroughly established both in England and in the United States at the time the act was adopted.
